citeinfo.title: Polygons representing thickness of the upper confining unit of the Floridan aquifer system
Revised Hydrogeologic Framework of the Floridan aquifer system in Florida and Parts of Georgia, Alabama, and South Carolina, U.S. Geological Survey Professional Paper 1807.

descript.abstract: This feature class contains polygon regions that represent thickness of the upper confining unit of the Floridan aquifer system.
descript.purpose: Shows thickness of the upper confining unit and extent of the intermediate aquifer system. Data available from: http://pubs.usgs.gov/ds/0926 or http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/ds926

theme.themekey: Florida, Georgia, Alabama, South Carolina, Hydrogeology, Stratigraphy, Floridan aquifer system, Geology, Regional Groundwater Availability Study, USGS, United States Geological Survey, thickness, extent, regions, upper confining unit, Intermediate aquifer system, Intermediate confining unit, IAS, ICU

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of the U.S. Geological Survey would be appreciated in products derived from these data.
idinfo.datacred: Williams and Kuniansky, 2015, Revised Hydrogeologic Framework of the Floridan aquifer system in Florida and Parts of Georgia, Alabama, and South Carolina, U.S. Geological Survey Professional Paper 1807. Report available from: http://pubs.usgs.gov/pp/1807/ or http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/pp1807

enttyp.enttypd: Polygons representing thickness of the upper confining unit of the Floridan aquifer system
